title: Hunt Seals Using Eskimo Stalking Method
brief: Approach seals by mimicking their behavior and movement patterns for hunting success.
steps: Step 1: Stay downwind from seal at all times during approach.
Step 2: Move closer cautiously while seal sleeps - they raise heads every 30 seconds to watch for polar bears.
Step 3: When seal moves, stop and imitate by lying flat on ice, raising head up and down, wriggling body slightly.
Step 4: Approach with body sideways and arms close to body to look like another seal.
Step 5: Get within 22-45 meters and kill instantly with brain shot.
Step 6: Reach seal quickly before it slides into water on smooth, inclined ice.
warnings: Seals are found near polar bears - bears have stalked and killed seal hunters.
Ice at breathing holes is usually smooth and inclined - seal may slide into water easily.
In winter, dead seals usually float but are difficult to retrieve from water.
Keep seal blubber and skin from contacting scratches or broken skin - can cause 'spekk-finger' reaction with severe hand swelling.
